fields.description:
Description:
Installing an app to Android with 4.2 version takes long time(60 Sec) . Console shows multiple lines: [DEBUG] /Users/tsmolich/android-sdk-macosx/platform-tools/adb -d shell mount.
Here is a console output:
{code}
[INFO] Waiting for SDCard to become available..
[DEBUG] /Users/tsmolich/android-sdk-macosx/platform-tools/adb -d shell mount

{code}

1. Install any app to Android with version 4.2
2. Check the console in Studio

Actual result:
Installing takes long time
fields.summary: Android: Installing an app to Android with 4.2 version takes long time
fields.environment:
Tested on: 
Titanium Studio, build: 3.0.0.201211131839 
Titanium SDK, build: 3.0.0.v20121113170203 
Devices: Nexus 10 (4.2), Nexus 7 (4.2)

comments.body: Can't reproduce this issue any more. Closing the bug as a non reproducible.
There is another customer having similar issue. Any idea about the issue? The customer is seeing this issue after he upgraded his Ti SDK to 3.0.0 and his Studio to 3.0.1.201212181159.

Hi I am the customer mentioned by Amuktha. I am experiencing this issue on an HTC with Android 2.3.4 . My device does have an SD slot but no card in the slot. This issue appeared after i upgraded to SDK 3.0.0 .

Verified fixed on:
Mac OSX 10.9 Mavericks
Titanium Studio, build: 3.2.0.201311122029
Titanium SDK, build: 3.2.0.v20131112144044
CLI: 3.2.0
Alloy: 1.3.0
Android Emulator: 4.2.2
Android Device: Xperia Arc S, 4.0.4

Project took 2 minutes to build and install on emulator including the time taken to load the emulator.
Project took 27 seconds to build and install on emulator.
Closing.
